subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... Think of it this way : foreach test method listOfTests.add( new TestCase() ) end foreach test in listOfTests test.setUp() test.run() test.tearDown() end
messageBody:
Cedric Beust wrote:
>
> How do you mean they are very different?
>

Think of it this way :

foreach test method
listOfTests.add( new TestCase() )
end

foreach test in listOfTests
test.setUp()
test.run()
test.tearDown()
end


Try this :

public class StaticInterferenceTest extends TestCase {
static int i;

public StaticInterferenceTest() {
i = 0;
}

public void testFirst() throws Exception {
assertEquals(1, ++i);
}

public void testSecond() throws Exception {
assertEquals(1, ++i);
}
}

then try again with a setup method.

Kevin
